trans-unit.source: Reference for navigating the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Reference for navigating the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Learn the different user experiences for App Service Web between the management portal and the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Learn the different user experiences for App Service Web between the management portal and the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Reference for navigating the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Reference for navigating the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Azure Websites is now called <link><linkText>App Service Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Websites is now called <link><linkText>App Service Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: We're updating all of our documentation to reflect this name change and to provide instructions for the New Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: We're updating all of our documentation to reflect this name change and to provide instructions for the New Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Until that process is done, you can use this document as a guide for working with Web Apps in the new Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Until that process is done, you can use this document as a guide for working with Web Apps in the new Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The future of the old portal
trans-unit.target: The future of the old portal

trans-unit.source: While you will notice the branding changes on the old portal, that portal is in the process of being replaced by the new Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: While you will notice the branding changes on the old portal, that portal is in the process of being replaced by the new Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: As the old portal is being phased out, the focus for new development is shifting to the new portal.
trans-unit.target: As the old portal is being phased out, the focus for new development is shifting to the new portal.

trans-unit.source: All upcoming new features for Web Apps will come in the new portal.
trans-unit.target: All upcoming new features for Web Apps will come in the new portal.

trans-unit.source: Start using the new portal to take advantage of the latest and greatest that Web Apps have to offer.
trans-unit.target: Start using the new portal to take advantage of the latest and greatest that Web Apps have to offer.

trans-unit.source: Layout differences between the old portal and Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Layout differences between the old portal and Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: In the old portal, all the Azure services are listed on the left hand side.
trans-unit.target: In the old portal, all the Azure services are listed on the left hand side.

trans-unit.source: Navigation in the old portal follows a tree structure, where you start from the service and navigate into each element.
trans-unit.target: Navigation in the old portal follows a tree structure, where you start from the service and navigate into each element.

trans-unit.source: This structure works well when managing independent components.
trans-unit.target: This structure works well when managing independent components.

trans-unit.source: However, applications built on Azure are a collection of interconnected services, and this tree structure isn't ideal for working with collections of services.
trans-unit.target: However, applications built on Azure are a collection of interconnected services, and this tree structure isn't ideal for working with collections of services.

trans-unit.source: The new portal makes it easy to build applications end-to-end with components from multiple services.
trans-unit.target: The new portal makes it easy to build applications end-to-end with components from multiple services.

trans-unit.source: The new Azure Portal is organized as journeys.
trans-unit.target: The new Azure Portal is organized as journeys.

trans-unit.source: A journey is a series of blades, which are containers for the different components.
trans-unit.target: A journey is a series of blades, which are containers for the different components.

trans-unit.source: For example, setting up auto-scaling for a web app is a journey which takes you several blades as shown in the following example: the web-site blade (that blade title has not yet been updated to use the new terminology), the Settings blade, and the Scale blade.
trans-unit.target: For example, setting up auto-scaling for a web app is a journey which takes you several blades as shown in the following example: the web-site blade (that blade title has not yet been updated to use the new terminology), the Settings blade, and the Scale blade.

trans-unit.source: In the example, auto scaling is being set up to depend on CPU usage, so there is also a CPU Percentage blade.
trans-unit.target: In the example, auto scaling is being set up to depend on CPU usage, so there is also a CPU Percentage blade.

trans-unit.source: The components within the blades are called parts, which look like tiles.
trans-unit.target: The components within the blades are called parts, which look like tiles.

trans-unit.source: Navigation example: create a web app
trans-unit.target: Navigation example: create a web app

trans-unit.source: Creating new web apps is still as easy as 1-2-3.
trans-unit.target: Creating new web apps is still as easy as 1-2-3.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows the old portal and the new portal side-by-side to demonstrate that not much has changed in the number of steps needed to get a web app up and running.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows the old portal and the new portal side-by-side to demonstrate that not much has changed in the number of steps needed to get a web app up and running.

trans-unit.source: In the new portal you can choose from the most common types of web apps, including popular gallery applications like WordPress.
trans-unit.target: In the new portal you can choose from the most common types of web apps, including popular gallery applications like WordPress.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of available applications, visit the [Azure Marketplace].
trans-unit.target: For a full list of available applications, visit the [Azure Marketplace].

trans-unit.source: When you create a web app, you specify URL, App Service plan, and location in the new portal just as you do in the old portal.
trans-unit.target: When you create a web app, you specify URL, App Service plan, and location in the new portal just as you do in the old portal.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the new portal lets you define other common settings.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the new portal lets you define other common settings.

trans-unit.source: For example, <link><linkText>resource groups</linkText><title></title></link> make it simple to see and manage related Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: For example, <link><linkText>resource groups</linkText><title></title></link> make it simple to see and manage related Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: Navigation example: settings and features
trans-unit.target: Navigation example: settings and features

trans-unit.source: All the settings and features are now logically grouped in a single blade, from which you can navigate.
trans-unit.target: All the settings and features are now logically grouped in a single blade, from which you can navigate.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can create custom domains by clicking Custom domains and SSL in the Settings blade.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can create custom domains by clicking Custom domains and SSL in the Settings blade.

trans-unit.source: To set up a monitoring alert, click Requests and errors and then Add Alert.
trans-unit.target: To set up a monitoring alert, click Requests and errors and then Add Alert.

trans-unit.source: To enable diagnostics, click Diagnostics logs in the Settings blade.
trans-unit.target: To enable diagnostics, click Diagnostics logs in the Settings blade.

trans-unit.source: To configure application settings, click Application settings in the Settings blade.
trans-unit.target: To configure application settings, click Application settings in the Settings blade.

trans-unit.source: Other than the brand name, a few things in the portal have been renamed or grouped differently to make it easier to find them.
trans-unit.target: Other than the brand name, a few things in the portal have been renamed or grouped differently to make it easier to find them.

trans-unit.source: For example, below is a screenshot of the corresponding page for app settings (Configure) in the old portal.
trans-unit.target: For example, below is a screenshot of the corresponding page for app settings (Configure) in the old portal.

trans-unit.source: More Resources
trans-unit.target: More Resources

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>The Azure cloud application platform</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>The Azure cloud application platform</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the new portal</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the new portal</linkText><title></title></link>
